Author: jamongkad
Content: Very Darwinian...but if anything else getting rejected should be seen in a positive light. As a time to get to know your users and build something that they will find useful. Just like in PG's essays.

Author: drusenko
Content: This past session (w2007) several of us have been working from home (Weebly, Zenter). OTOH, the crystal towers situation is quite nice, it beats any office i know of hands down. Several other startups chose to go to an office b/c they were used to that (heysan), so i think it goes both ways.

Author: staunch
Content: I think hiring is the root cause behind this kind of "good enough" attitude. Most companies treat hiring as a chore to be got out of the way as quickly as possible. The people they hire treat their projects the same way. Mediocrity all around.\n
